text: Luyana, also called Luyi, is a Bantu language of the Niger-Congo language family. It is spoken mostly in Zambia. The language is taught in primary schools and secondary schools.https://www.ethnologue.com/language/lyn Luyana | Ethnologue The language uses the Latin alphabet. It was made in 2011. == References == Category:Bantu languages Category:Languages of Zambia
title: Luyana language
